questionnaire.title: irAKI vs Other AKI Classification Assessment (Enhanced)
questionnaire.description: Comprehensive clinical assessment to distinguish immune-related acute kidney injury from other AKI etiologies
questionnaire.reference: Based on Sprangers et al. Nature Reviews Nephrology 2022 and clinical guidelines with peer-review enhancements

questions.question: The temporal relationship between immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) exposure and AKI onset strongly supports irAKI diagnosis
questions.description: Assess the timing of AKI development in relation to ICI therapy initiation/continuation. Note: combination ICI regimens typically have shorter median time-to-irAKI (4-8 weeks) vs monotherapy (â‰¥12 weeks)

supportive_evidence: AKI onset 2-5 months after ICI initiation (monotherapy)
AKI onset 4-8 weeks after combination ICI initiation
Clear temporal sequence without other explanations
AKI development during active ICI treatment
contradictory_evidence: AKI onset >12 months after ICI discontinuation
AKI pattern inconsistent with typical irAKI timeline

specialty_focus.medical_oncology: ICI treatment timeline and dosing history

questions.question: Prerenal causes of AKI have been adequately excluded
questions.description: Evaluate whether volume depletion, hypotension, or reduced effective circulating volume explains the AKI

exclusion_evidence: Lack of response to appropriate fluid resuscitation

questions.question: Postrenal/obstructive causes of AKI have been adequately excluded
questions.description: Assess whether urinary tract obstruction or structural abnormalities explain the AKI

questions.question: Other intrinsic causes of AKI (ATN, contrast nephropathy, other drugs) have been adequately excluded
questions.description: Evaluate alternative intrinsic kidney injury mechanisms beyond immune-mediated causes

exclusion_criteria: Careful medication review excludes other nephrotoxins
No evidence of muscle breakdown or hemolysis

questions.question: Urinalysis findings are consistent with immune-mediated kidney injury
questions.description: Assess urinalysis pattern for findings suggestive of tubulointerstitial nephritis or immune injury

atypical_findings: Red blood cell casts (suggests glomerular disease)

questions.question: Laboratory evidence suggests systemic immune activation consistent with irAKI
questions.description: Evaluate biomarkers and laboratory findings indicative of immune system activation

assessment_considerations: Inflammatory marker correlation with AKI timing

questions.question: Concomitant medications known to cause AKI/ATIN have been adequately assessed and excluded
questions.description: Evaluate exposure to medications commonly associated with acute tubulointerstitial nephritis

assessment_approach: Temporal relationship analysis for each medication

questions.question: The presence of other immune-related adverse events (irAEs) supports the diagnosis of irAKI
questions.description: Assess whether concurrent or previous irAEs support immune-mediated etiology

questions.question: Kidney biopsy is indicated and expected to show findings consistent with immune-mediated injury
questions.description: Assess the appropriateness and expected yield of kidney biopsy for confirming irAKI

biopsy_indications: AKI stage 2 or higher without clear alternative cause
Need to exclude other glomerular diseases

specialty_focus.medical_oncology: Risk-benefit of biopsy in cancer patients

questions.question: The clinical course and expected response pattern are consistent with irAKI
questions.description: Evaluate whether the natural history and treatment response support immune-mediated etiology

typical_course: Subacute onset over days to weeks

specialty_focus.nephrology: AKI recovery patterns and steroid response
specialty_focus.critical_care: Clinical course in critically ill patients

questions.question: Alternative systemic diagnoses for AKI have been systematically excluded
questions.description: Comprehensive assessment excluding systemic and cancer-related specific causes of AKI in this clinical context

questions.question: Overall clinical judgment strongly favors irAKI as the most likely diagnosis
questions.description: Integrative clinical assessment considering all available evidence

confidence_factors: Quality and completeness of available data

questions.question: Infection-related AKI (septic ATN, pyelonephritis, other infectious causes) has been systematically excluded
questions.description: Systematic exclusion of infection-mediated AKI in immunosuppressed cancer patients

exclusion_criteria: Absence of fever or systemic inflammatory response
No evidence of pyelonephritis or other renal infections

specialty_focus.emergency_medicine: Rapid infection screening and risk assessment

questions.question: Radiologic findings support immune-mediated kidney injury or exclude alternative structural causes
questions.description: Assessment of imaging evidence for intrinsic parenchymal injury patterns consistent with or contradicting irAKI

supportive_findings: No evidence of cortical necrosis or infarcts

specialty_focus.radiology: Imaging pattern recognition for immune vs other causes
specialty_focus.nephrology: Correlation of imaging with clinical presentation
specialty_focus.emergency_medicine: Rapid imaging interpretation for alternative causes

questions.question: Baseline renal reserve, age-related changes, and frailty have been appropriately considered in AKI assessment
questions.description: Assessment accounts for baseline CKD, geriatric factors, and individual patient vulnerability

assessment_considerations: Lower threshold for significant AKI in CKD patients

specialty_focus.geriatric_medicine: Age and frailty impact on AKI presentation and recovery
specialty_focus.clinical_pharmacy: Medication adjustments for baseline renal function
specialty_focus.nephrology: Baseline CKD impact on AKI severity and prognosis

questions.question: The risk-benefit profile supports rechallenge with ICI therapy after AKI recovery
questions.description: Assessment of whether restarting ICI is appropriate based on AKI severity, recovery, and cancer prognosis

favorable_factors: Clear alternative cause identified and addressed
Excellent cancer response to ICI therapy
No other viable treatment options available
unfavorable_factors: Incomplete renal recovery or CKD progression
KDIGO stage 3 AKI with prolonged course

specialty_focus.medical_oncology: Cancer prognosis and alternative treatment options
specialty_focus.nephrology: Renal recovery assessment and rechallenge risk

interpretation.1-3: Evidence strongly against irAKI / Alternative diagnosis likely
interpretation.7-9: Evidence strongly supports irAKI / High probability diagnosis

confidence_thresholds.high_confidence: â‰¥7 on â‰¥12 questions with no major contradictions
confidence_thresholds.moderate_confidence: â‰¥6 on most questions with some uncertainty

consensus_calculation.minimum_agreement: â‰¥70% of experts within 2 points on final gestalt
consensus_calculation.debate_threshold: â‰¥3 point disagreement on any question

recommendations: Consider irAKI if clinical course changes
Address baseline CKD and frailty factors

validation.content_validity: Reviewed by multidisciplinary expert panel with peer-review feedback integration
validation.clinical_correlation: Based on published irAKI case series, guidelines, and expert consensus (Sprangers et al. 2022)
validation.inter_rater_reliability: Target >0.8 agreement among expert reviewers across 16-question assessment
validation.sensitivity_analysis: Question weighting validation against clinical outcomes and rechallenge decisions
validation.expert_coverage: Comprehensive specialty representation including infection disease, radiology, and geriatrics
